### Problem 1.19 <span id=recpoints>{4}</span><span id=report>{ A=4 | E=0 }</span>

```{r}
mydata1 <- fread('http://users.stat.ufl.edu/~rrandles/sta4210/Rclassnotes/data/textdatasets/KutnerData/Chapter%20%201%20Data%20Sets/CH01PR19.txt')
colnames(mydata1) <- c("Y","X")
lm1 <- lm(data = mydata1, Y ~ X)
answer1 <- summary(lm1)
pander(answer1)
plot(data = mydata1, Y ~ X, main = '1.19 QUESTION', xlab = 'ACT test score', ylab = 'GPA' )
abline(lm1, col = 'red')
```

1. $\beta_0$ = 2.114  $\beta_1$ = 0.03883  $Y_i$ = 2.114 + 0.03883 * $X_i$
2. somewhat fit with the line, but there are a lot of outliers existing around the line.
3. Y = 2.114 + 0.03883 * 30 [3.2789]
4. 0.03883

### Problem 1.20 <span id=recpoints>{4}</span><span id=report>{ A=4 | E=0 }</span> 

```{r}
mydata2 <- fread('http://users.stat.ufl.edu/~rrandles/sta4210/Rclassnotes/data/textdatasets/KutnerData/Chapter%20%201%20Data%20Sets/CH01PR20.txt')
colnames(mydata2) <- c("Y","X")
lm2 <- lm(data = mydata2, Y ~ X)
answer2 <- summary(lm2)
pander(answer2)
plot(data = mydata2, Y ~ X , main = '1.20 QUESTION', xlab = 'the number of copiers serviced ', ylab = 'the total number of minutes spent by the service person' )
abline(lm2, col = 'blue')
```


1. $\beta_0$ = -0.5802  $\beta_1$ = 15.04   $Y_i$ = -0.5802  + 15.04 * $X_i$
2. the line fits into quite well
3. since the p-value of intercept($\beta_0$) is higher than 0.05 (level of significance), we do not have enough evidence to reject the NULL.
4. Y = -0.5802  + 15.04 * 5 [74.6198]
